title: Suggestion: Some small buffs (mostly QoL changes) for Soraka
body:
Soraka is in a quite balanced state now (leaning towards weak side tho) and I think she would love some small buffs which will make playing as Soraka way more enjoyable but not break her in any way. I came up with three changes and I will explain them below.

1. Soraka's passive movement speed bonus getting Volibear's Q treamment. It feels really bad to lose all movement speed when you have to go around a wall to save a low hp ally. Decaying ms would make Soraka's passive a way more reliable tool to use.

2. Her E getting a higher tickrate. Right now her E silence refreshes in 0,25 second intervals which allows many champions to freely cast spells when inside a silence zone if they get out of Zhonya's, GA or use things like Fizz E or Zed shadows. Increasing the tickrate to 0,1 second or more would greatly reduce the number of situations where this spell is not working as intended.

3. Rejuvenation bonus from hitting Q procing from epic monsters. Right now Soraka is pretty uninteractive when it comes to contesting Dragon or Baron. She can only deal a small amount of damage with Q and use her W heal with no way of restoring her own health after using it. Allowing Soraka to proc her Q passive on epic monsters (but not large) would allow her to be more interactive with the game and feel more enjoyable for Soraka player to play around objectives. Not to mention a quite similar ability, Rakan's Q, works on epic monsters.

What do you think about those changes? Will Riot ever implement them?

{{sticker:sg-soraka}}

replies.body:
These are some really nifty suggestions. Personally, I'm hoping for bigger kit changes but I'd take any of these suggestions as an appetizer while I wait.

{{sticker:sg-soraka}}
Hey, it’s you!  Good to see you again, Mama Soraka! :)
Hi {{sticker:sg-kiko}}

What do you think about changes like this:

1. Make her ultimate a skillshot (similar how Heimers grenade or Cho´s Q are working) which is globally. Maybe make it so that you can click on the portrait of an ally above mini map so it places the skillshot automatically on his current position if you click R on it. This ult would also have a charge system. (Allies will see an indicator where her ult will hit)

2. Increase the impact of her healing on the W but also give it a longer cooldown, so she has to make more impactful decision when to heal which ally (especially in teamfights).

This changes would increase her skill ceiling while also giving her larger room to be buffed.

I'd be willing to see her iconic ultimate changed if it meant we could have more fun stuff in the rest of her kit.

As for the second change, well, that just sounds like partially reverting her W to what it used to be (minus the armor buff) which is fine by me. Larger heals on a longer cooldown tend to be more fun for me. I've even picked up support Kayle lately just because I feel better when I use Kayle's W than Soraka's and that really seems like it shouldn't be the case given that Soraka is supposed to be the premier healer.

The Rejuvenation bonus from epic monsters might be abusable, since there's not really a risk to it. Just let your adc push, Q the dragon and come back to lane with more health. However, we don't see a lot of Rakans do it, so it's apparently not that big of a deal.

Otherwise, great suggestions. Riot please make it happen

To be fair, Soraka Q has a 235 radius, which means it is slightly longer-ranged than Rakan Q after all is said and done. Still, so long as Soraka has walk to the opening of the dragon to Q it instead of doing so over the tribrush wall, I think it'd be pretty un-abusable.

But even then, how many situations are there where Soraka can abuse starcalling dragon then healing someone from tribrush? It's not often that a aomething happening from behind dragon wall and she's in range of someone actively fighting from there

I was more considering the lane sustain problem, where a blue-side Soraka can walk to dragon pit, Q it for health (since the dragon can't dodge, unlike her enemy laners) and then come back. Obviously in the middle of a fight, it's less valuable since you'll want to be Q-ing the enemy champions for damage/slows on top of the healing, but in slow lane phases, it could theoretically keep Soraka topped up forever if she has the mana to blow.

I think that regardless of which side she's on Soraka can Q dragon from a safe position, making it so that she can't Q from behind dragon pit means she has to enter river with no escape path while red side Soraka can walk in from blue buff. (and I'm pretty sure in both circumstances Soraka can get out of aggro range while dragon is getting up)

Though it might need nerfs, I'm all for the idea of giving enchanters more power on the map (she'll only be roaming to Q dragon when an ally is not nearby imo) and taking power out of their duo/teamfight synergy. (of course it still has to be their main thing).

 {{sticker:zombie-nunu-bummed}}

1 and 3 are straight up buffs, and 2 is a bugfix.

They're all good ideas, but none of these are QOL.

> [{quoted}](name=Bârd,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=0ar90ITH,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-04-02T15:15:15.440+0000)
>
> 1 and 3 are straight up buffs, and 2 is a bugfix.
> 
> They're all good ideas, but none of these are QOL.

What is your definition of quality of life? 

IMHO buffs to a champion and bugfixes are all quality of life changes because it makes the champion feel better to play improving the quality of play for those who play the champion.

A QOL buff is anything that makes the champion feel better to play that doesn't actually change their numbers or mechanics.

Examples include...

Patch 4.8, when the per-target CD indicator was added for Udyr's bear stance.

Patch 4.18, when Anivia's Q was changed to show the stun radius to Anivia while the projectile was in flight.

Patch 6.9, when Fiddle's R was changed to auto-ping "On my way" when cast.
These are great examples. Anything that the enemy team can notice is probably not a QoL change.

Not necessarily, some QOL changes were made for clarity going up against enemies.

Best example of that would be when they made tether ranges visible to the targets for things like LB chain and Fiddle drain.

Hmm, fair point. Perhaps, "A change to the User Interface that modifies how you learn, process, or view information, without providing any more information than you could have had before." It's getting less elegant as a simple rule, but we're definitely on the same page about what this means.
By that logic, every buff is a QoL buff.
{{champion:45}} R now does 100% Max HP True Damage at any amount of health, and resets on kills. My Quality of Life has now improved because the enemies cannot win.

Improving the quality of play isn't the same as any other regular buff.

QoL changes very specifically make them *feel* better to play, and don't make them feel worse to play *against*.

This includes indicators and positive bugfixes (making a mechanic work properly in a way that results in a minor buff), but can also include minor buffs like making it easier to clear camps (without necessarily making it faster or healthier), making checks for abilities slightly more gratuitous, or, yes, letting Raka heal off of Qing drake/baron.

> [{quoted}](name=An Enemy Sutando,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=0ar90ITH,comment-id=000200000001,timestamp=2018-04-02T16:44:55.748+0000)
>
> By that logic, every buff is a QoL buff.

I agree any buff is a quality of life improvement.
All seem fair. I like it.

Buffing champs for no reason?
Of course they will!

Of all of them, the only significant buff proposed here is #3.

1 is nice from a "why am I speeding up and slowing down" perspective but unless you're running to heal a tank, the high burst nature of damage these days means you're either in range to heal the target (and are already doing so) or the target is dead.

2 is a bugfix with a fairly minor associated power spike. The real advantage here would be rewarding good play - dropping your E behind someone being ulted by Zed to stop some of his followup damage, for example. Right now, it's only really useful if somebody has already dropped a stun or root on the target, because you have enough time to hit escape tools before it applies the silence.

3 is a flat out buff, and I have some concerns about skewing Soraka's win rate bot lane based on Dragon access. It makes Blue side VERY attractive, since it's much easier and safer to duck up to Q the dragon pit on Blue side.

Overall, though, Soraka doesn't really need buffs. She's already sitting at a ~51% win rate, so changes should be done very carefully to avoid overbuffing her. She did have some identity issues when they first released the new runes (basically: ADCs could provide better self-sustain than Soraka could), but they've since toned down some of the life gain from runes so that's less of a problem now.

That aside, I would love to see another mini-rework of her kit to allow for non-toxic play outside of a bot lane support role.

Who told you Soraka was weak? She's a pain in the ass to deal with. That click-heal-click-heal-click-heal is the most braindead shit I've encountered in this game.
She needs a rework, not buffs.
Have you ever tried stopping a Lucian with her E? It's impossible.

The issue is what do you propose they remove from her kit that makes her problematic when strong in exchange for this? Not a big nerf or change since what you suggest aren't huge changes but at the same time there's a reason she was nerfed into her current state.

I love these ideas even if they are small changes. She deserves much more than what the meta has been providing for her. I personally think they should revert the changes they made to her Q, returning what it use to do in season 5. They said the changed it due to the fact that "assassin's weren't able to burst her down". Well.. since lethality became a thing that has NOT been an issue whatsoever. I really hope they do something..

Soraka is a cheesy pick to stomp in laning phase. If you lose to a passive Sorakas that doesn't even abuse her early strengths you deserve the loss. For 800 gold you can nullify any advantage that Soraka brings in terms of heals in mid game and thats where most games are decided.

So Soraka has only two issues: 

* Grievous Wounds, the most unhealthy debuff (obtainable from items) this game ever had and 
* she is too oppressive in laning phase, because this is the only aspect of her that makes her a decent pick

She is not uninteractive, she is not braindead, you need to land your skillshots and she doesn't just spam W, people who say that just lost to bad Soraka players and are salty. 

Fixing her E and all that is fine and all but it's not gonna change anything.

If your impression is that Soraka is weak then you are either not using your early game well enough or you are not snowballing your matches well enough.

If Soraka doesn't win early she needs to hope that her opponents are stupid and don't buy Grievous Wounds (which happens surprisingly often) or stall long enough to get close to full build and win very late.

All of these seem reasonable, and this is coming from a guy that has no problem getting a/s on Soraka.

I'd even go so far as to propose she get Q regen from hitting large monsters so she can jungle again.
I love these ideas.  The last one might be a little strong (perma-rejuvenation heals while doing Baron, anyone?) but our dear goat lady needs any buff she can get right now.
